question: Take it, Goliath. It's yours. Glad you're still here, lady
answer: It's my apartment.

question: You're awake.
answer: I've been awake. Since you left.

question: Sorry.
answer: What, with my dinner? I never had a mother. I'll learn.

question: I'll do the cooking.
answer: There are probably all kinds of things prowling around up there. In the middle of the night.

question: I'm sorry. Really. You...have to be there at dawn. They ride the wind over the ridge.
answer: Dawn? You left at one A.M.

question: I had to go fishing. It's the fish that bring them down, so I can get a close look at them. I've tracked a dozen of them, Jill. Twelve of those big bruisers. I can actually recognize them. I've even given them names, over the years.
answer: You've been doing this for years?

question: Only in the early Autumn. When they're' migrating.
answer: I'II set the alarm for next. October.

question: Beauty... isn't simple. If it was... I'd be beautiful.
answer: You are.

question: No, no, no. I'm simple. You, on the other hand... ...have all that... stuff... hiding underneath somewhere. That's what fascinates me.
answer: Fascination. Not love?

question: I... honestly don't know. I guess I've been... living alone too long. You're the first, the only woman I've ever thought of as... a real partner.
answer: I've always been...afraid of living alone. I've always had... people... talking at me... knowing they could wind me up and I'd do... ... whatever they wanted.

question: Aw, no... ...L-Lucky.
answer: They... they come outta the trees, Reddy. Don't... don't know what they was. Figure... maybe some kinda... wolves, or somethin' ... I... I never seen 'em comin'.

question: Don't try to talk, Rake. I know. You... kept the place runnin'... better than me.
answer: I just...never seen 'em comin', Reddy. Never even...had a chance to...turn a gun on 'em.

question: Where are they going? There's nothing in there... except...
answer: Y'oughta... remember it... real good. I do. From... when you was a kid.

question: The... the old Arkley place?
answer: I remember them days. I surely do... Remember them... them old days.

question: Who are you?
answer: Who are YOU? What the hell is S.T.A.R.S.?

question: How'd you get in here?
answer: Who sealed the door?

question: I lost three me. You killed them, Wesker. You did... and I did. Because I didn't know what to expect... because you... didn't tell me!
answer: Tell you what?

question: Anything! I wasn't told anything!
answer: Put down the gun.

question: Not until...
answer: RELEASE! THAT'S AN ORDER, SOLDIER!

question: How ya doin' , Valentine? Good to see ya. Glad you're still alive. Same here, colonel, I'm...
answer: How did you get in here?

question: The same way those fuckin' dogs got out! Through their pens! I... locked them off.
answer: Good thinking. Ladies first.

question: Victory, friend. Civilization has come a long way, but we still have... war. Imagine... a soldier who can't die. That... was the concept.
answer: But the virus... jumped.

question: Hopefully... if we got all the dogs... we've contained it.
answer: Hopefully? Jesus... why didn't you tell us?

question: There are override exits... but I can't find them without THIS!
answer: That was a smart move.

question: And... you are?
answer: Nobody. Just a...a local guy...

question: His name is Chris Redfield. He was... part of my cover, sir.
answer: Cover?

question: This is not the time to mouth off, Chris! You're in deep shit here!
answer: Why didn't you let me in on this?

question: Why did you have to come after me? How did you get in here, anyway?
answer: I used to play here, when this was a fucking laundry room! And what makes you think I came after YOU?

question: You up to the challenge?
answer: Try me.

question: I already have. Jill, I... I'm sorry. I'm just... angry. When I... thought you were gone, I... Then... when I saw you. Alive. I realized that...
answer: That you were still... fascinated.

question: Stop. Stop!
answer: I...I want to. I want... nothing more. But... I can't. When I'm in this uniform, I'm more than... just me. Try to understand...there's no "I" in Team, Chris.

question: There's no "I" in DEAD, either.
answer: You go. You're not part of this.

question: Hustle it, Vickers. You're the guy we need. To cut into the network. Watch these entrances, guys.
answer: AAAAH ! Shit.

question: Hold tight. It doesn't sound like it's on this level.
answer: Shit. I'm locked out. Any clues for a password?

question: Try... Umbrella.
answer: Nothing. Wait. I'm into... No. No data. Just some kind of video feed. Time-coded. Yesterday. It's a play-back. Holy shit!

question: Scram! SCRAM!
answer: Haul ass, boss!

question: That's...two I owe ya.
answer: One. We were all... 'Even-Steven' .

question: Those things could get up here. We can't let that happen. This is our way out... Caruso. Thank you.
answer: Any time. How do we get back UP?

question: Shit, if you didn't have a plan, you shouldn't have jumped down here.
answer: We have a real problem here, Chris.

question: How big is this place? How many people were down here? How...
answer: HOW DO WE GET UP?

question: Big. Heavy.
answer: It got you!

question: Stand down. Five minutes.
answer: I'm through, Wesker.

question: You want to wait here, fine. You can't. Not without this.
answer: Fuck you! And your fancy doors and your green key! The choppers have rockets. They can blow out a wall if they have to. I'm callin' 'em in.

question: How many digits did you receive?
answer: Six. The beginning of an air- support code, but... it just went dead on me.

question: Call S.T.A.R.S. in Washington. I want...
answer: Hold it...

question: Call Washington anyway. I want the authority to take action if necessary.
answer: No independent action.

question: Where the explosives are. Down... farther than we need to go. We only have to make it down one more level. If... when... we make it back up to the choppers... we can fly out of the detonator's signal range.
answer: I'm not willing to rely on that. I live here, this is my town!

question: The town's been evacuated. Just... just in case.
answer: That explains the lie. About the plane crash. An airplane down... with weapons on board... would nicely explain a big explosion, wouldn't it? You figured all along you might have to blow this place!

question: I don't want to do it. I... I hope I don't have to.
answer: I...I can't let this happen. I've got to find that bomb.

question: I...I can't let this happen. I've got to find that bomb.
answer: I'll help. Once Wesker gets what he wants, my obligation is over.

question: No. I want you out. With the rest of them. Wesker won't push the button until you're clear.
answer: He doesn't want to push the button.

question: He has to. Don't you see? He can't leave these labs here. And, Jesus... walking corpses! He's gotta get rid of the evidence.
answer: Chris, no!

question: This way.
answer: No. That way. Chris and the others...

question: If they're dead, they're dead. If they're alive, they'll still be alive in twenty minutes. When we get back.
answer: Maybe not. And how do we know it's only going to be twenty minutes? How do we know we'll be able to come back this way?

question: Sullivan! JESUS, SULLIVAN!
answer: Get out of the away!

question: They.. .they killed Sullivan. The bastards... whoever did this shit... they KILLED SULLIVAN!
answer: Hold this.

question: I... can't take this any more.
answer: We take what comes. That's the secret of our genius.

question: Not very old at all. Not nearly old enough to...to...
answer: None of us is old enough for that.

question: Jill... told me... you were nice .
answer: She did? She never told me.

question: You lost a man. If I had only been faster. I was unfamiliar with the mechanism. Don't worry, it's mindless. It doesn't realize that it's strong enough to push the door open.
answer: Hasn't happened to me, yet.

question: My... colleagues. Benjamin. Toshiro. As far as we know, we are the...only ones.. .left alive. We worked on "C" level. One of the biologists saved us. Brought us down here. He knew that... he didn't have long to live. He... started the mechanism... out there, in the corridor.. .and he let it... take him.
answer: You did fine, lady. We're obliged.

question: Is it true? Are you here to... rescue? Or destroy?
answer: Both. If I have to pick only one... I'll pick destroy.

question: You're not S.T.A.R.S. You're Umbrella.
answer: Once again. Both. Two salaries. Three if you count combat pay.

question: The man I loved, John Marcus... developed the organism that caused all this. He... he did it for humanitarian purposes. It was taken away from him...for in-human purposes...by men like you!
answer: No, ma'am. Men like me... are just errand boys. Sent in to do the wet-work. All of the glory. None of the benefits.

question: After what you've seen down here, do you think any of it could be turned into... benefit?
answer: Yes. I think it could be turned into five or ten million dollars. How do we get into "D" lab?

question: It's called... the Tyrant. Nobody knows it exists. Except us... and Holden.
answer: Holden?

question: Umbrella's man in D.C. We need him. He signs the checks. We've got it, Barry! Our fortune!
answer: You're not gonna try to get this big mother outta here ?

question: Don't have to. All we need is the data. Then.. .these things can be cranked out on an assembly line!
answer: What about the antidote?

question: Antidote? There is no antidote. That was just happy horse shit, to keep the team going.
answer: You're gonna give this to Umbrella?

question: No. Pot blue or green. Red.
answer: Red... overrides green.

question: Yes.
answer: So... you could have unlocked "D" lab.

question: I was hoping it would never be un- locked again. Go. I will see that this.. . ... is destroyed.
answer: It's destroyed. It's worthless But you're not.

question: I helped develop it!
answer: Unwittingly. They lied to you. They lied to Marcus. They made you believe you were doing a good thing when it wasn't good at all. It was evil!

question: That's one helluva big pump.
answer: An implant.

question: From what? A fuckin' elephant?
answer: Rhinoceros.

question: Shit. I figured you knew more than you were telling.
answer: I told you, we don't. W-we can't. It's unstoppable!

question: Level "B".
answer: Don't see anything.

question: Good. We're almost there. You'll have to jump off. The belt won't stop.
answer: Bats! There are bats in here!
